profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: Correspondence and leaflets regarding student unrest at Stanford and the University of California, and the Mississippi Freedom Project.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Joseph Kadane Papers (SC). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Joseph Kadane, a 1966 graduate of Stanford University (Ph.D., statistics), was speaker for the Legislature of the Associated Students of Stanford University (LASSU), member of the LASSU Rules Committee, and member of the University's Committee of 15.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Collection contains correspondence and leaflets regarding student unrest at Stanford and the University of California, the Mississippi Freedom Project, and the Free Speech Movement; and agenda, minutes, resolutions and other materials of the Associated Students of Stanford University.

Mississippi Freedom Project, Stanford Vietnam Newsletter, Stanford Young Democrats, ACLU, student sit-in at President Sterling's office, Student Action on Americans for Reappraisal of Far Eastern Policy, Stanford Committee for KPFA, etc.
by-laws, statements, newsletters, broadsheets, and series of articles by Bill Berkowitz on "Stanford Student Given Greater Responsibility"

did.unittitle: Associated Students of Stanford University, legislature
Associated Students of Stanford University, legislature

scopecontent.p: agenda, minutes, bills, budgets, and reports by committee

did.unittitle: Associated Students of Stanford University, constitution

scopecontent.p: Committee of Fifteen report "On-campus residence policy for women students," questions regarding the Report of the Subcommittee on Judicial Procedure, Stanford Daily By-Laws changes, directive from the Undergraduate Women Legislature Representatives, and draft for a resolution regarding Voluntary Organizations

did.unittitle: Off Campus Political Activity - Free Speech Movement

scopecontent.p: progress report, newsletters, provisional platform, student political action report, etc.

Bay Area Council for Democracy, Student Non-violent Coordinating committee, California Federation of Young Democrats, Nelson Newsletter re: HUAC, Friends of Vietnam newsletter, Student Action on Apartheid in South Africa, etc.
